title: Support internal links to specific sections/headings for navigation with deduplicate tabs
body:
### Enhancement Checklist

- [x] I have searched existing issues and this is not a duplicate
- [x] I am reporting a simple enhancement or improvement within Vertical Tabs, not requesting new features or addressing compatibility issues with other plugins
- [x] I understand that proposals for new features should be discussed in the â€˜Discussionsâ€™ tab
- [x] I understand that compatibility issues with other plugins should be posted as a â€˜Compatibilityâ€™ issue

### Enhancement Type

Usability

### Enhancement Description

The plugin should also navigate to sections/headings of a opened note if the user clicks on an internal link with headings (`[[Note B#Section A]]`) if `Note B` already has a tab, just like what would happen if `Note B` does not have an opened tab yet. (See motivation for more details)

### Motivation

Currently, when using tab navigation with a preset that has deduplicate tabs enabled, the following behaviour occurs: 
If `Note B` is already opened, and from `Note A` an internal link to a heading/section of `Note B` is clicked (`[[Note B#Section A]]`), the tab from `Note B` will get focus, but won't go to `Section A`. This does not occur if `Note B` is not opened yet; in that case it will open a new tab that will have `Section A` in the viewport. Making these have the same behaviour would make navigation better and make the `[[Note B#Section A]]` links actually work when `Note B` is already opened on another tab.

### Alternatives (Optional)

_No response_

### Additional Information (Optional)

_No response_

comments.body: Hi @nbeerten ! This functionality has been implemented and will be available in the next release. Thank you!

title: Saving and Switching of Multi-Group Visibility State
body:
# Feature Overview

allows users to save and restore the visibility states of multiple Groups

# Use Case

I use different groups to organize my workflow. Depending on different work requirements, I need to flexibly show or hide these Groups.

For example: 
I have 5 Groups: A, B, C, D, and E. 
1. In some cases, I only need to display Groups A, B, and C.
2. In other cases, I only need display Groups C, D, and E.
3. Sometimes, I need to use all 5 Groups simultaneously.

# Current Limitation

Currently, Obsidian's Workspace feature cannot meet this need. While the workspace feature can save window layouts, they cannot maintain the hidden state of Groups. 

For example:
- If the current state is: Group A displayed, Group B displayed, Group C displayed, Group D hidden, Group E hidden
- Save this state as Workspace "Flow 1"
- Later, when reopening Workspace "Flow 1", all Groups A, B, C, D, and E will become displayed.

This behavior limits users' ability to quickly switch Group visibility based on different workflows.

The dirct integration of this plugin with Obsidian's Workspace feature may be complicated.
But Workspace feature is not needed if we can save and restore the visibility states of multiple groups.

# Needed Features

1. **Save Group States**: Allow users to save the current visibility state of all Groups as a named configuration.

2. **Quick Switching**: Provide a dropdown menu ( or command palette option ) for users to quickly switch between different saved configurations.

3. **Edit Configurations**: Allow users to edit saved configurations, such as renaming, deleting, or modifying Group states.

4. **Hotkey Support**: Offer customizable hotkeys for saving the current state and switching to specific configurations.

## Expected Benefits

1. Convenience: Users can quickly switch between different work modes without manually showing/hiding Groups.
2. Reduced Distractions: Help users stay focused by only displaying Groups relevant to the current task.

title: Click Tab in Hidden Group Should be Displayed
body:
Currently, when a tab within a hidden group is clicked, the group remains hidden and the tab is not displayed.

When a tab within a hidden group is clicked, the group should be set as visible and the clicked tab should be displayed.

Thank you for your nice work!
author: fornewfork

comments.body:
Thank you!

> Currently, when a tab within a hidden group is clicked, the group remains hidden and the tab is not displayed.

This is, in fact, intended behavior. I admit that it is unintuitive and could cause confusion. May I ask which of the following solutions you think is the best option?

1. When a group is hidden, display only its name and hide all the tabs within the group. When the user search a tab (implementing), matched tabs of a hidden group will be displayed, but greyed out.

eg.

Before:

- Group 1:
  - Tab 1
  - Tab 2
- Group 2:
  - Tab 3

After:

- Group 1 (hidden)
- Group 2:
  - Tab 3

Search for the keyword "2":

- Group 1 (hidden)
  - Tab **2**
- Group **2**

2. (As described in your request) Show the hidden group and the tabs within. When a tab is clicked, automatically unhide the group and open the tab.

I think we could keep both solutions, since they work fine for different cases.

- For case of **few goups with many tabs in each group**, the **search solution** is better.

eg.

Group 1:
Tab 1
Tab 2
...
Tab 10

Group 2:
Tab 11
...
Tab 20

- For case of **many goups with few tabs in each group**, the **click solution** is better.

eg.

Group 1:
Tab 1
Tab 2
Tab 3
Group 2:
Tab 4
Tab 5
Tab 6
...
Group 5:
Tab 13
Tab 14
Tab 15

> When a tab within a hidden group is clicked, the group should be set as visible and the clicked tab should be displayed.

The original feature has been implemented. I'll release this shortly. More refinements will come after refactoring.

title: Support multiple windows
body:
Hello,
thank you very much for your plugin, it's very useful ! 
I work with multiple windows, but the plugin only recognize the tabs and groups open in the main one, it is possible to get those open in other windows ? thanks for your answer.
author: Trebuchosaure

comments.body:
Hi! Thank you for suggesting. I'm not sure if this is possible or the best option. I'll check with this.

By the way, could please explain why would you use multiple windows with multiple tabs open? Since most people don't have many open tabs in secondary windows and the design of Obsidian encourages the following use pattern:

- You are encouraged to work primarily on a single window to focus on your work.
- The main window provides sidebars, in which auxiliary information is gathered.
- _Vertical Tabs_ should be in the sidebar. There must be exactly only one instance of _Vertical Tabs_.
- You may open, duplicate or move a few active notes to a secondary window only for some special purposes, for example, pinning on the top of the window stack, moving to another monitor.
- If you want to put the notes side by side, you should use workspace split instead.

Excluding tabs in secondary windows is not a missing feature of _Vertical Tabs_, instead, it is designed to be so. But I will consider your suggestion if it is technically possible.
Good news! It is technically possible: bc370c050b520d81745caa4c840875ecbcf5ed15. Still working on it.

Hi,
thank you for your quick answer !  And I'm very happy it's possible ! 
Yes, I'm working on dual monitor, I use the secondary one to show text references, or stuff like that. But sometimes I need to have multiple tabs on my secondary monitor.

thanks again !

Tabs in secondary windows are now visible in *Vertical Tabs*. There are still some limitations, though,

- *Vertical Tabs* should be in the sidebar. There must be exactly only one instance of *Vertical Tabs*.
- Features like *Zen Mode* and *Show Active Tabs* only work in the main window.

Further refinement requires a huge refactoring, but will come in the future. Stay tuned!

If you have other suggestions or run into some issues, feel free to reopen this issue if related, or open another issue. Thanks!
